candidates.title: Customer Order Tracking Portal
candidates.description: Enable customers to self-service check their order status without contacting support. Customers (Contacts in Salesforce) can log into a portal to view their current and historical product orders.
acceptance_criteria: Customers can log into the portal using their email/credentials
Dashboard shows overview of customer's orders
List displays order details: number, date, status, items
Customers can view orders from the last 12 months
Order statuses are displayed in customer-friendly language
Customers can cancel orders that are not yet shipped
technical_notes: Need to implement caching for performance
Permission model differs for B2B vs B2C
dependencies: Experience Cloud licenses must be available
Account type access rules need definition
GDPR compliance for B2B order visibility

candidates.title: Shipment Tracking Integration
candidates.description: Integrate with shipping providers (DHL, PostNL) to show real-time tracking information for shipped orders.

out_of_scope: Included in v1 (explicitly moved to phase 2)

candidates.title: Order Delivery Address Modification
candidates.description: Allow customers to change the delivery address for orders that haven't been shipped yet.
acceptance_criteria: Customers can edit delivery address before shipping
System validates if modification is still possible
Recalculates shipping costs if address changes

candidates.title: Customer-Friendly Order Status Labels
candidates.description: Replace technical order statuses with customer-friendly labels in the portal.
acceptance_criteria: Define mapping: technical status -> customer label
All portal pages use friendly labels
